cit.name: J. Train
cit.title: Hist. & Statist. Acct. Isle of Man
cit.usage: A light-haired male or female is deemed unlucky to be a first-foot or quaaltagh on New Year's morning.

oed.def: The first person to enter a house on New Year's Day; = first foot. Also: the first person one meets after leaving home, esp. on a special occasion.

def: the first person you meet on New Year's Day
my-usage: Although not notably superstitious, X couldn't help thinking it auspicious as he stepped out for a pastry at the local patissiere that the quaaltagh was a notably cheerful and evently fortune-favored gentleman.

cit.name: Abp. G. Abbot
cit.title: Expos. Prophet Ionah
cit.usage: Perfidious, and fedifragous, and barbarous Princes.

oed.def: Pledge-breaking, faithless, perfidious. Also as n. with the: promise-breakers as a class.

def: promise-breaking, oath-violating

cit.name: Contemp. Rev.
cit.usage: The concomitant proditomania. [Note A morbid belief in the ubiquity and omnipotence of traitors.]

def: the irrational belief that everyone around you is a traitor

cit.name: tr. M. Mancini
cit.usage: The order..seem'd to exclude my Sister as a Cadette.

def: a younger sister or daughter
